DOC.brief_summary: Dual antiplatelet therapy essential patient follow ST-Elevation myocardial infarction ( STEMI ) percutaneous coronary intervention ( PCI ) drug elute stent implantation . Current guideline recommend prasugrel ticagrelor patient STEMI undergo primary PPCI . We seek investigate superiority antiplatelet effect term PR level load dose ( LD ) Prasugrel ( 60 mg ) versus LD Ticagrelor ( 180 mg ) diabetic patient STEMI undergo primary PCI 1 2 hour post drug administration . Secondary end-points : PR level measure 6 12 hour post study drug administrationin hospital . All consecutive diabetic patient STEMI undergo PPCI stent implantation consider PR assessment 1-2-6-12 h drug LD administration . All patient must naïve platelet P2Y12 receptor inhibition therapy . A subanalysis perform two study group accord insulin treatment .
DOC.brief_title: PraSugrel v TicagrElor ST-Elevation Myocardial Infarction paTients With Diabetes Mellitus
DOC.criteria: Diabetic patient acute coronary syndrome patient underwent primary PCI naïve platelet P2Y12 receptor inhibition therapy history bleed diathesis chronic oral anticoagulation treatment contraindication antiplatelet therapy PCI coronary artery bypass grafting ( CABG ) < 3 month hemodynamic instability platelet count < 100,000/μl hematocrit < 30 % creatinine clearance < 25 ml/min Patients history stroke contraindication prasugrel administration patient weigh < 60 kg patient treat morphine > 75 year age .
